summary: This is a search warrant issued by the U.S. District Court for the District of Virgin Islands authorizing the search of Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little Saint James, for evidence related to sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy. The warrant details the structures on the island and specifies items to be seized, including documents, photographs, and electronic devices.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The search warrant targets his private island, Little Saint James, for evidence of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy. Items to be seized include those owned or used by him.

persons.name: Ruth Miller
persons.context: Issued the search warrant and is the judge to whom the warrant and inventory must be returned.

connections.description: Judge Miller authorized the search warrant for Epstein's property.

events.title: Search Warrant Execution Deadline
events.description: The search warrant for Little Saint James Island must be executed on or before this date.

locations: Little Saint James Island, U.S. Virgin Islands
keyFacts: The search warrant authorizes a search of Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little Saint James, for evidence of violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (Sex Trafficking of Minors) and 371 (Conspiracy).

Items to be seized include documents/communications regarding victims, nude/sexually suggestive photographs of teenage girls or younger, 'child erotica,' and computer devices owned or used by Epstein.
The warrant describes at least 13 distinct structures on the island, including multiple residences, cabanas, maintenance buildings, and a dock house.
The warrant was issued by United States Magistrate Judge Ruth Miller and had an execution deadline of August 24, 2019.
The warrant authorizes the seizure of items to identify co-conspirators and evidence of their presence at the property.
